lines.text: [first lines]

[Zonker is submerged under Walden Puddle]
Zonker! Zonker!

[underwater]
Steady, lads, steady...
Zonker!
Fire!
[a miniature trident shot from underwater pins a falling leaf to a tree]
Zonker!

[his head comes out of the water]
What?
Dinner's in ten minutes.
So?
We'd prefer you dry.

[B.D. is ranting about Vietnam]
Why isn't he watching the game?
His favorite halfback was killed.
I think I know something of the necessity of change. My life hasn't exactly been devoid of rage either.
You mean your old man back in Denver?
Uh-huh, but I stopped fighting it.
[remembering]
My last batch of perfect french fries was delivered to the dinner table July 21st, 1972.

[smiles]
You still make the best.
Yes, but not in Denver.

[everybody's making fun of Mike's cooking]
Joanie...
Yes?
This is really your responsibility.
Mine?
You *know* Mike needs supervision when he walks into that kitchen.
I know and I'm sorry... I left the room for a second and then everything fell apart.

[talking about her work at the day care]
Mike, it's a whole new generation of hearts and minds out there, and that challenge goes a long way in justifying the earlier pain. I mean...
[the scene shifts from the kitchen to the day care]
it's the same struggle getting through the day, taking care of the kids... yes, yes and, and feeding them and, uh, picking up after them and stopping their fights.
[she laughs]
Yes... but I'm getting paid for it!
How much?
Not enough, honey.
[last lines]

[he's back under Walden Puddle]
What happened to everyone? Ah, nothing special. Just... caring in different ways.
[a leaf falls towards the water, blown by the wind]
Feeling the present as it moves by. Things gotta change, right?
[his head emerges and he watches the falling leaves, laughing]
And the trees agree!
[pause, then]
Good going, trees.
[he slowly submerges, waving to the trees and the falling leaves]

[Zonker has just announced his conclusion that the commune is passe]
Where will I go? Who will I be? What'll I eat?
Those are heads-up questions, Mark, because unless you're from Vermont the commune is finito.

[Ellie is waiting for her outside the commune]
Mike, go out and entertain the wave of the future, will you?

[to Mike, talking about Joanie]
How come you got her doing the dishes, Mike?
It's her turn, Ellie. She'll be out in a minute.
Oh. I didn't mean to be strident or anything.
That's okay. I've been there.
During the revolution?

[laughing]
The revolution? What would *you* know about the revolution?
Well, it was against what's-his-name... Nixon, and it was fun and usually held outdoors.
Ellie, it was a little more complicated than that.
[pause, then]
We're all still trying to figure it out.
Even as we speak?
Even as we speak.
